Detailed Description

The CachingSortProvider sort rows of its child provider by using a special caching algorithm. First the values to be sorted are read and sorted block wise. Then these blocks are merged together by comparing the smallest value with the smallest value of each block. With this algorithm the data has only to be accessed twice. Hence the CachingSortProvider is meant to sort provider with slow data access (e.g. with data stored in FFS). If the data access is fast or the data is already cached still the QuickSortProvider should be used to assure the best possible performance. If no memory is available to cache the entries the QuickSort algorithm will be used.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CachingSortProvider::CachingSortProvider (   ) 
 

If the default constructor is used, the parameters have to be provided by using the method Init.

CachingSortProvider::CachingSortProvider (  Provider *  provider,
INT  columnid = 0,
BOOLEAN  order = TRUE
) 
 

On construction the following parameters have to be specified: provider: The provider which should be sorted. columnid: Specify which columnid has to be sorted. order: Specify whether ascending (TRUE) or descending (FALSE).
